reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a week, returning this morning. I repeatedly said that I couldn't fault the hotel. We both agree that it was amazing value for money and the location - just steps to Union Square - simply couldn't be bettered.
reviews.title: Absolutely divine hotel- class all the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decor was stunning and I was very sad when it came time to check out!
reviews.title: Perfect weekend getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very accommodating staff and lovely little touches such as the afternoon sherry, and complimentary morning coffee. A very chic experience.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would not hesitate to stay here again when next we are in San Francisco. THANKS KENSINGTON PARK! :-) 10/10.
reviews.title: Romantic, beautiful rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend in San Francisco. We stayed at the Kensington Park Hotel and this is where we will stay if/when we return to the city. The location is perfect - it's literally in the heart of Union Square. Union Square, to me, was definitely touristy and not really my favorite part of town, but the central location is perfect. My husband and I love to walk around and explore the city and this allowed for us to do so very easily. Also, if you're new to San Fran, you feel really safe because there are always lots of people around. Additionally, there are great amenities (Walgreens, coffee shops, breakfast places, etc) right around the corner.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel, close to transport and Union Square. As mentioned by other reviewers, this is an older hotel which adds to the charm. Rooms are small but have been modernised and are very inviting. Bathroom is very small and there's no real bench space, but this is only a minor inconvenience. Some have mentioned the street noise can be annoying - we did hear sirens etc but with the window closed, it wasn't an issue.
reviews.title: Charming hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took the train from the airport and walked the three blocks up to the hotel. It wasn't that far, but if you have lots of luggage, might be a bit of a struggle. Check-in was quick and hassle-free. Seemed like a good area and we felt comfortable walking around.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, great location! Book it now!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant looked next to the hotel looked very nice but we didn't have a chance to go. There's also a little cafe on the other side of the hotel which we had breakfast at one morning, which was ok but nothing special.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I couldn't decide where to stay in SF but we definitely picked the right spot! We were right on union square with shops, restaurants & bars right on our doorstep without the need for taxis, public transport etc. The rooms were v.spacious, extremely comfy beds & modern looking also had free wifi. Great rates generally available in comparison to some other hotels that seem dingy and very old fashioned!! Definitely recommend staying here over Fishermans Wharf which is fine for an afternoon & a burger but nowhere for you to enjoy a nice meal & btl of wine etc. Only downside was the parking at $35 per day but you can't escape this if u want to stay in this central area. Would recommend to anyone going to SF!
reviews.title: Great Stay!
Nice hotel in a great location
reviews.text: We consider ourselves very lucky in finding this hotel. Its location is superb, in short walking distance from Union Square. The hotel is charming, and our room was spacious, clean, I would even say luxurious. On the minus side, there is no breakfast included, but you will not find any trouble in finding a nice place for having breakfast in the area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Location for this hotel. Old looking interior but quality of bedding and furniture new. Bathrooms not modern, but very clean. We asked for a Queen size bed, but bed small like a UK double and very uncomfortable as mattress very very soft, it killed both our backs with either small pillows which were too hard. We were overlooking Post Street and traffic noise was quite bad and midnight boy do you hear the bins being emptied. I feel the windows needed double glazing as they are old metal sash windows.Reception staff very helpful plus they have sherry and coffee between 5pm and 7pm
reviews.title: Old in parts,great location,but noisey due traffic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at the Kensington Park for three nights, and I'll have to say that we were wonderfully surprised at what we found for the price we paid. The rooms were very nice and roomy, and the staff was very cordial and helpful. The location can't be beat. We will definitely stay there again on our next trip to San Francisco.
reviews.title: This hotel more than met our expectations.

reviews.text: I travel frequently for both business and pleasure and prefer the boutique hotel whenever possible, as I like my surroundings to feel like the city I am in. Kensington Park does just that - and at a fantastic rate.
reviews.title: You Cannot Go Wrong at Kensington Park

reviews.text: The Union Square location puts you in the heart of downtown. The rooms are spacious, updated and very tastefully designed. The entire hotel is sparkling clean and the service is excellent and very friendly. It is not loaded with amenities, such as on-site fitness center or restaurant, however, there is a complimentary fitness center at a neighboring property and some of the best restaurants in the city within 100 feet. To top it off, I had the pleasure (guilty?) of knowing that my colleagues paid 3X what I paid for equivalent rooms at some of the high-end chains in the area,
reviews.title: Wonderful gem in the heart of town.......(:

reviews.text: The only negatives are very slow internet service and low water pressure in the shower, but that is standard fare in most older buildings in all cities.
reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: Location: The location of this hotel is great, smack in the Union Square area.
reviews.title: Great Union Square Location

reviews.text: Service: Generally good, nothing outstanding, but nothing unprofessional either. Besides checking in/out, we didn't really deal with the front desk or concierge. The cleaning service person was very friendly.
reviews.title: Fantastic fantastic fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: Did not eat.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money! surprised and happy
Amazing Beds! really good location
reviews.text: Gym/Pool: I don't believe they have a gym. But 24 Hour Fitness is within 10 minutes walk.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: Nice. The room was larger than I feared for a "boutique-type" hotel. The shower door was wonky but not a major nuisance. The wifi availability is good.
reviews.title: Wow wot a lovely hotel
